official-title.#text:
To amend the Public Health Service Act to extend health plan coverage to dependent children in the
			 individual and group market, contingent on the enactment of legislation
			 repealing the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, and for other
			 purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Securing Health Care for Young Americans Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Securing Health Care for Young Americans Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subpart 1 of part A of title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act

text.#text:
A group health plan and a health insurance issuer offering group health insurance coverage that
			 provides dependent coverage of children shall continue to make such
			 coverage available for such a dependent after such dependent turns 18
			 years of age until the first of the following events occurs:
The dependent turns 26 years of age.

internal-xref.#tail: , the dependent no longer resides in the home of—

text.#text: the policy holder through which such dependent is eligible for dependent coverage; or

in the case that the policy holder through which such dependent is eligible for dependent coverage
			 provides such coverage subject to an order to provide child support, the
			 dependent’s parent or legal guardian.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 102 of the Higher
			 Education Act of 1965

internal-xref.#tail:
shall not apply to a dependent for any period of time during which such dependent is enrolled as a
			 full-time student at a postsecondary educational institution (including an
			 institution of higher education as defined in

text.#text: Nothing in this section shall require a plan or an issuer described in

internal-xref.#tail:
to make coverage available for a child of an individual receiving dependent coverage pursuant to
			 this section.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to the tax treatment of the cost of
			 coverage.

text.#text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to modify the definition of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall promulgate regulations to define the dependents to which coverage shall be made
			 available under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 2703A of the Public Health Service Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subpart 1 of part B of title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply to health insurance coverage offered to individuals by
			 a health insurance issuer in the individual market in the same manner as
			 it applies to health insurance coverage offered by a health insurance
			 issuer in the group market.

header.#text: Effective date contingent on repeal of PPACA

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
repeal legislation described in paragraph (2) and such
			 subsections and amendments shall have no force or effect if such
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

text.#text:
Subsections (a) and (b) and the amendments made by such subsections shall take effect upon the
			 enactment of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
repeal legislation described in this paragraph is legislation
			 that—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

external-xref.#tail:
, and restores or revives the provisions of law amended or repealed,
			 respectively, by such Act as if such Act had not been enacted and without
			 further amendment to such provisions of law; and

			 without further amendment to such provisions of law.
